etymologies: early 16th century: from ecclesiastical Latin catechismus, from ecclesiastical Greek, from katēkhizein (see catechize)

definitions: a summary of the principles of Christian religion in the form of questions and answers, used for the instruction of Christians.
shortDefinitions: summary of principles of Christian religion in form of questions and answers

definitions: a series of fixed questions, answers, or precepts used for instruction in other situations

examples.text: the preventive health catechism “more exercise, less tobacco and alcohol, and better diet”

shortDefinitions: series of fixed questions, answers, or precepts used for instruction
